text.section: An individual employed by a permit holder shall be registered with the Board as a transporter before the individual may remove and transport human remains.

To register as a transporter, an individual shall submit to the Board:
A signed application on the form that the Board requires;
A criminal history records check; and
Evidence of the completion of coursework recommended by the Board.

The Board shall register an individual who:
Holds a valid driver's license; and
Has complied with all applicable State and local laws.

While a registered transporter removes and transports human remains or otherwise acts in the capacity of a registered transporter, the registered transporter shall:
Treat every decedent with the utmost dignity; and
Prominently display on their person the permit for the mortuary transport service for which the transporter is employed.
